availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Kenyon T. Skeen (Simpson Co. KY, farmer)

body.p: Simpson County, Kentucky, farmer. Tennessee native. Married to Permelia Skeen. Father of Jasper N. Skeen, Archibald Skeen, Mary E. Skeen, and America F. Skeen. Farmer in Simpson County, Kentucky, in 1860. Employed H. C. Brooks as a laborer in Simpson County in 1860. Owned two enslaved persons in Simpson County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Simpson County, p. 71.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Simpson County, p. 304B.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Mortality Schedules, Kentucky, Simpson County, The East Half, p. 1403.
Find A Grave, "Kenyon Taylor Skeen (26 Nov 1809-4 Nov 1869)," Memorial #49689547, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/49689547 (accessed September 15, 2020).
